thread.title: Do or die Game 4 for Royals against Astros
thread.title_full: Do or die Game 4 for Royals against Astros - KCTV5

author: DeAnn Smith, Digital Content Manager
title: Do or die Game 4 for Royals against Astros
text:
Royals manager Ned Yost said the Royals battled the flu in September and he was going to let it run its course.
Monday, he will find out whether the ailing bats and sporadic starting pitching doom the Royals season or they live to fight another day.
The Astros are on the verge of eliminating the AL Central champs after Sunday's win gave Houston a 2-1 lead.
Lance McCullers got the nod for Houston. The 22-year old posted a 3.22 ERA, the best among rookies with at least 20 starts. Hard-throwing Yordano Ventura got the ball for the Royals. He finished the season with a 2.38 ERA in his last 11 starts.
Both pitchers started the first inning by hitting a player on the hand. Neither throw appeared intentional.
In the second inning, Royals catcher Salvador Perez was visibly upset after a foul ball hit a young fan. Shortly after that, he hit a two-run opposite field home run, giving the Royals the lead.
In the bottom half of the frame, Ventura gave up a home run to centerfielder Carlos Gomez. He gave up a second home run to Carlos Correa in the bottom of the third. Ventura is pitching on short rest.
